moves.1. e4: This was the second of games with this time limit - it is the longest setting on the blitz section. I had won the previous one, on the white side of a Nimzo-Indian fairly comfortably. As she had annotated that one http://gameknot.com/annotation.pl/real-time-game?gm=61234 I felt duty bound to annotate this one.
moves.1... e5: I opened e2-e4 to make a change. I had opened d2-d4 against her in our previous game. Maybe my first mistake?
moves.2. Nf3: I stick with the main move.
moves.2... Nc6: So does she. It did cross my mind to deliberately lose this game, to my lovely opponent, to encourage her. Then I thought "well she would never respect me if she found out I deliberately lost", but as it happened, I lost anyway!
moves.3. Bb5: So I play the Spanish, considered best.
moves.3... a6: And this is the most common reply.
moves.5... Be7: She plays the closed variation, as opposed to the open variation, starting with Nxe4.
moves.9. exd5: It would be ungallant to refuse a pawn from such a charming lady.
moves.12. d3: The modern way. d2-d4 used to be played here.
moves.15... Qg6: She attacks my pawn on d3. Funnily enough I looked at Bf5-g4 and thought, what of it? My queen can always go to e4. Then I go and play.
moves.16. Ne4: This of course is motivated by a desire to save my d pawn. She already could have played Bf5-g4.
moves.16... Rae8: But she plays this instead. I should have saved my queen with h2-h3, but instead I make another huge error.
moves.17. Bd2: I played this, thinking I was now threatening Ne4-d6, now that my rooks were connected.
moves.17... Bg4: Ouch! I learn that she is not just a pretty face! I have to give up my queen for two bishops - but I still have fighting chances, as I have an extra pawn too!
moves.20... Qg6: Queen returns to g6, forking d6 and d3
moves.21. Ne4: The only way to save both.
moves.22... Nxe4: She exchanges - giving me a strong centre.
moves.23. fxe4: This recapture also gives me play on the f file.
moves.23... c5: She prevents me from playing d3-d4 with a dominating centre.
moves.24. Bd5: I love this square for the bishop. I rather thought I was getting back into the game here. However around here the phone went. It was a chess playing friend, who is hard to get hold of. We had a lot to talk about, and I foolishly tried to play and chat at the same time.
moves.26. Be3: So I hit the c pawn.
moves.27. Bf4: So I hit the rook again.
moves.27... Re7: Rook moves. Now surely best is Be3 and black has to somehow figure out how to stop the repetition. But, as I said, I was foolishly trying to conduct a telephone conversation at the same time, and I made a terrible mistake.
moves.28. Bd6: Thinking I was attacking the rook again. As soon as I made it, I realised my mistake.
moves.28... Qxd6:
It is now hopeless. I resigned.
Many thanks for reading, please rate this annotation, and leave a comment or two to let me know how I am doing! Until next time, dear reader!
